definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: Don't mention it can also use?
"No, thank you, " I said. "But I have to tell you something.
sentences.chinese: “不用謝，”我說，“但我有些事情想告訴你。

sentences.english: Mr. Li need not thank me, I actually don't do what.
sentences.chinese: 黎先生你不用謝我，我真的沒做什麼。

sentences.english: C: You're welcome.We hope you will enjoy your journey.

sentences.english: You're welcome.We hope you will enjoy your journey.

sentences.english: There is nothing to thank me for, dear Adeline;
sentences.chinese: 沒什麼好謝的，親愛的艾德琳，一點也不用謝。
你只需要對她說不用謝。

sentences.english: Don't metion it , I did nothing.
sentences.chinese: 你不用謝我，我並沒有做過什麼。

sentences.english: The lawyer said, "Oh, don"t thank me.
You're welcome, glad to be of assistance.

sentences.english: Not at all. Thanks for calling. Good-bye.
sentences.chinese: 不用謝，謝謝你打電話來，再見。

sentences.english: Not at all, dear. It was a pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 不用謝，這是我樂意做的事。
